Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Mastoparan-L (Mastoparan L, MP L, natural AMPs; Ala-rich; Leu-rich; insects, arthropods, invertebrates, animals; XXA, UCLL1c)

Literature Information.Literature: Activity: Active against collistin-resistant A. baumannii (Vila-Farres X et al 2012. Clin Microbiol Infect 18 (4), 383-7), B. subtilis ATCC6633 (MIC ~20 uM), E. faecalis ATCC 12953 (MIC ~10 uM), S. aureus ATCC 29213 or MRSA (MIC 10-20 uM), S. pyogenes (MIC ~10 uM),  E. coli (MIC 10-30 uM), K. pneumoniae (MIC 10-20 ~uM),  P. aeruginosa 10-20 uM), S. enterica (MIC 10-20 uM) (Silva et al., 2020).MOA:cancer: It also induced apoptosis of cancer cells (B16F10-Nex2) in vitro and and in vivoanimal model:cancer:mouse(de Azevedo RA et al., 2014).Structure:  K: 21%.  Helical in TFE, SDS, DPC, and PCPG. One alpha helix from 4 to 11.You can rotate, zoom, and view the 3D structureherein the PDB.Toxicity:  It is less hemolytic HC50>100 uM (40% at 100 uM) and can cause histamine releasing (57.6% at 10 uM) (Kawakami et al., 2017). human RBC: HC50 82.9 uM; rat RBC: HC50 242.5 uM. (Ye et al., 2023).Updated 12/2011; 5/2017; 6/2022; 7/2024.
Literature Information.Author: García JR, Krause A, Schulz S, Rodríguez-Jiménez FJ, Klüver E, Adermann K, Forssmann U, Frimpong-Boateng A, Bals R, Forssmann WG1979
Literature Information.Title: A new mast cell degranulating peptide "mastoparan" in the venom of Vespula lewisii
